p: In accordance with the CA, the populations “I”, “DS”, “Mo”, “MS”, “Mu”, “G”, “SS”, “L”, “A” and “BM” were classified into the same category, while, “B” and “S” were grouped into the individual subclasses. The first group possessed α-bisabolone oxide A and α-bisabolol oxide A as the major constituents as well as apigenin and luteolin (chemotype I). The second chemotype (II), was characterized by high amounts of chamazulene and α-bisabolol oxide B. The chemotype (III) was the richest in ( Z) and ( E)-γ-bisabolene.
